message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.NE, cs.CV, cs.SY

The paper discusses a general framework for learning low-variance, unbiased gradient estimators for black-box functions of random variables, which is applicable in both discrete and continuous settings. This suggests that the paper could belong to several sub-categories related to machine learning and optimization. Specifically, cs.LG (Machine Learning), cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence), and cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) are likely candidates as they are all related to the development and application of machine learning algorithms. Additionally, cs.CV (Computer Vision) is a possible sub-category as the paper mentions using gradients of a neural network, which is commonly used in computer vision tasks. Finally, cs.SY (Systems and Control) is also a possible sub-category as the paper introduces an unbiased, action-conditional extension of the advantage actor-critic reinforcement learning algorithm, which is related to control theory.
